item.title: 欧洲央行霍尔茨曼称下周降息将 "温和 "进行
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员罗伯特-霍尔兹曼（Robert Holzmann）表示，下周决策中的任何利率下调都将是 "温和的"。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Robert Holzmann said any reduction in interest rates at next week’s decision will be “moderate.”】

item.title: 特朗普财政部长人选将与图恩和主要参议员会面商讨确认事宜
item.description: 财政部长提名人斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）计划在本周晚些时候与即将上任的参议院共和党领袖约翰-图恩（John Thune）和其他主要参议员会面，开始为确认听证会做准备。【原文：Treasury secretary nominee Scott Bessent plans to meet later this week with incoming Senate Republican leader John Thune and other key senators as he begins preparing for confirmation hearings.】

item.title: 莫桑比克总统任命莱特拉为新总检察长
item.description: 莫桑比克总统菲利佩-纽西（Filipe Nyusi）任命阿梅里科-莱特拉（Américo Letela）为新任总检察长，莫桑比克正等待宪法委员会对 10 月份有争议的选举进行确认。【原文：Mozambique President Filipe Nyusi appointed Américo Letela as new attorney general as the nation awaits the Constitutional Council’s validation of October’s disputed elections.】

item.title: AQR 的克利夫-阿斯内斯（Cliff Asness）说，人工智能已经取代了他的部分工作
item.description: AQR 资本管理公司的克利夫-阿斯内斯（Cliff Asness）说，这家量化公司正在积极部署人工智能；包括在投资流程的核心部分，而这些部分过去一直是联合创始人的领域。【原文：AQR Capital Management’s Cliff Asness says the quant firm is actively deploying artificial intelligence — including in the core parts of the investing process that used to be the co-founder’s domain.】

item.title: 捷豹老板称其争议广告旨在吸引眼球
item.description: 捷豹总经理表示，捷豹汽车品牌改头换面的两极化预告视频完全达到了预期目的：吸引眼球。【原文：Jaguar’s polarizing teaser video of the car brand’s makeover achieved exactly what it set out to do, according to its managing director: attract attention.】

item.title: 真实的振动实验来了
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 亿万富翁萨利纳斯的伊莱克特拉公司跌至 2007 年以来的最低点，原因是市场疲软加剧
item.description: Elektra 集团的股价跌至 2007 年以来的最低点，加深了本周已经从控股股东里卡多-萨利纳斯-普利戈（Ricardo Salinas Pliego）的财富中抹去 55 亿美元的颓势。【原文：Shares of Grupo Elektra plunged to the lowest since 2007, deepening a rout that already wiped out $5.5 billion from the fortune of controlling shareholder Ricardo Salinas Pliego this week.】

item.title: 亚马逊将提供五倍功率的人类芯片集群
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）将为人工智能合作伙伴 Anthropic 提供大规模的国产芯片集群，并称这将使该初创公司目前的处理能力提高五倍。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. will provide artificial intelligence partner Anthropic with a massive cluster of homegrown chips it says will quintuple the startup’s current processing power.】

item.title: 劳斯莱斯股票大涨后估值达 500 亿英镑
item.description: 罗尔斯-罗伊斯控股公司（Rolls-Royce Holdings Plc）的估值首次达到 500 亿英镑（630 亿美元），该公司股票在远程喷气发动机需求旺盛的背景下继续飙升。【原文：Rolls-Royce Holdings Plc’s valuation reached £50 billion ($63 billion) for the first time as the stock extends a surge on the back of buoyant demand for long-haul jet engines.】

item.title: 受制裁油轮将俄罗斯原油长途运往苏伊士运河
item.description: 就在英国扩大对俄罗斯能源业的制裁之际，一艘从波罗的海向印度运输俄罗斯原油的油轮正绕道英国，航程异常漫长。【原文：A tanker hauling Russian crude from the Baltic Sea to India is taking an unusually long route around the UK, just as Britain expands sanctions against Russia’s energy industry.】

item.title: 镓和锗是什么？受中国出口禁令影响的小金属
item.description: 镓和锗这两种不起眼但却至关重要的金属成为中美贸易战升级的最新棋子。12 月 3 日，在乔-拜登总统的政府对美国实施新的技术限制后，中国宣布禁止向美国出口这两种金属，以牙还牙。中国政府去年已对这两种材料的出口实施了初步控制，从而推高了价格并扰乱了贸易流动。【原文：Two obscure yet crucial metals, gallium and germanium, are the latest pawns in the escalating US-China trade war. On Dec. 3, China announced an export ban on both metals to the US in a tit-for-tat move after President Joe Biden’s administration implemented its own new technology curbs on the country. Beijing had already placed initial controls on exports of the materials last year, driving prices higher and upending trade flows.】

item.title: 美国电池制造商 Eos 完成联邦贷款，股价大涨
item.description: 电池制造商 Eos Energy Enterprises 公司获得了 3.035 亿美元的美国联邦贷款担保，股价大幅上涨，拜登政府正努力在卸任前完成数十亿美元的清洁技术贷款。【原文：Battery-maker Eos Energy Enterprises Inc. closed a $303.5 million US federal loan guarantee — sending its shares sharply higher — as the Biden administration races to finalize billions of dollars in clean-tech loans before leaving office.】

item.title: 南非 2024 年经济增长预期可能落空
item.description: 南非农业部门经历了至少三十年来最严重的衰退，导致第三季度经济出现意外萎缩，因此有可能无法实现 2024 年的经济增长预期。【原文：South Africa risks missing its 2024 economic growth forecast after the agricultural sector’s deepest slump in at least three decades led to an unexpected contraction in the third quarter.】

item.title: 加州少年被怀疑是散蜘蛛黑客团伙成员
item.description: 据几位熟悉内情的人士称，上个月在加利福尼亚州被捕的一名被指控的青少年黑客被怀疑是臭名昭著的网络犯罪组织 Scattered Spider 的成员。【原文：An accused teenage hacker who was arrested last month in California is suspected of being a member of the notorious cybercrime group Scattered Spider, according to several people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 韩国的军事统治令人惊讶，但并不新鲜
item.description: 12 月 3 日，韩国政府宣布实施戒严令，国内外为之震惊。但韩国有戒严和军事统治的历史。以下是有关背景的简要介绍。【原文：It came as a shock both domestically and abroad when South Korea’s government declared martial law on Dec. 3. But the country has a history of martial law and military rule. Here’s a quick primer on the background.】

item.title: 美联储研究报告称，美国大学关闭率预计将飙升
item.description: 由于学校面临潜在学生人数减少的问题，每年关闭的学院数量将大幅增加。【原文：The number of colleges that close each year is poised to significantly increase as schools contend with a slowdown in prospective students.】

item.title: 英国统计局危机归咎于恐惧文化
item.description: 据官方文件和熟悉情况的人士称，英国就业统计危机的原因是资金紧张、缺乏现代化以及工作人员不敢提出问题。【原文：A crisis around Britain’s employment statistics has been blamed on funding constraints, a lack of modernization and staff being afraid to raise problems, according to official documents and people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 投资者对委内瑞拉在特朗普领导下取得突破失去信心
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普赢得总统大选意味着美国对委内瑞拉的政策将有一个新的开始，但这种希望已经开始破灭。【原文：Hopes that Donald Trump’s presidential win would mean a fresh start for US policy toward Venezuela are starting to fade.】

item.title: 咖啡交易商在狂跌的一个月中追缴了 70 亿美元保证金
item.description:
阿拉比卡价格近乎垂直上涨，使得一些大牌生产商在发现自己缺乏现金支持套期保值后，竞相调整财务状况。【原文：

A nearly vertical run-up in arabica prices has left some big-name producers racing to square up their finances after finding themselves short on cash to back their hedges.

item.title: 欧洲央行帕内塔称欧盟需要共同债务来保持竞争力
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员法比奥-帕内塔说，欧盟需要共同借贷才能与美国竞争，并确保欧洲大陆未来的增长和创新。【原文：The European Union needs common borrowing to compete with the United States and ensure a future of growth and innovation for the continent, European Central Bank Governing Council member Fabio Panetta said.】

item.title: 特朗普关税给多伦多股票投资者带来不对称风险
item.description: 在当选总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁将跨境贸易关税从之前预期的 10%提高到 25%之后，多伦多和纽约的股票投资者面临着截然不同的风险。【原文：Equity investors in Toronto and New York face vastly different risks following President-elect Donald Trump’s threat to ramp up tariffs on cross-border trade to 25% from previous expectations of 10%.】

item.description: 韩国总统宣布戒严后，美国国债周二反弹，刺激了避险资产需求。【原文：US Treasuries rallied Tuesday after South Korea’s president declared martial law, stoking demand for haven assets.】

item.title: 劳动力需求稳定，美国职位空缺回升至 770 万个
item.description: 美国 10 月份的职位空缺有所增加，而裁员现象有所缓解，这表明对工人的需求正在趋于稳定。【原文：US job openings picked up in October while layoffs eased, suggesting demand for workers is stabilizing.】

item.title: 韩国宣布戒严，股市暴跌，韩元下跌
item.description: 韩国总统宣布戒严后，韩国资产暴跌，引发了投资者对政治不稳定和动荡的担忧。【原文：South Korean assets tumbled after the country’s president declared martial law, sparking investor concern about political instability and unrest.】

item.title: 银行家找到了为避免排放申请信贷的方法
item.description: 随着世界上最大的金融业自愿碳核算框架致力于扩大标准，银行家们很快就能为他们所说的融资帮助避免的排放申请信贷。【原文：Bankers will soon be able to claim credit for emissions they say their financing has helped avoid, as the world’s largest voluntary carbon accounting framework for the finance industry works on broadening standards.】

item.title: 资金流向穷国，世界银行呼吁减免债务
item.description: 世界银行的顶级经济学家呼吁私人贷款人承担免除最贫穷国家债务的部分费用，因为创纪录的高还款额耗尽了本应集中用于卫生、教育和基础设施建设的预算。【原文：The World Bank’s top economist called on private lenders to shoulder some of the cost of debt forgiveness for the poorest countries, as record high repayments drain budgets that should be focused on health, education and infrastructure.】

item.title: 欧盟为电动汽车电池提供援助以避免中国竞争
item.description: 依赖中国零部件的电动汽车电池制造商面临着被欧盟削减 10 亿欧元补贴的风险，因为欧盟的目标是促进其自身的生产和供应链。【原文：EV battery manufacturers relying on Chinese components risk being cut out of €1 billion in European Union subsidies as the bloc aims to boost its own production and supply chains.】
